content: I'd like to have rust-highfive for the Reference guide. What's the process for getting this to happen?

@isHavvy I know you at least have to add a triagebot.toml: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/triagebot.toml
I don't know if there are other steps.

@isHavvy Take a look at the wiki: https://github.com/rust-lang/triagebot/wiki/Enabling-triagebot

TL;DR: putting a triagebot.toml file in a rust-lang repo is enough to enable it. The wiki then describes the sections, like [assign] or [relabel]

I'm a bit confused by these responses. AFAIK, triagebot and highfive are two independent things.

I believe setting up highfive involves adding a config to https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/tree/master/highfive/configs/rust-lang, and infra setting up the webhooks to the bot.

AFAIK, triagebot and highfive are two independent things.

... they are? what's the difference?

highfive is the bot that welcomes you on a PR and automatically assigns a reviewer based on some rules in the config files.

triagebot offers various commands via @rustbot for labeling, taking assigning ownership of issues, etc.

I think there is some intent for triagebot to take over highfive's job, but I think that is delayed.
it is indeed delayed, and they are entirely different bots
highfive is also the one that manages toolstate IIRC
